logical function is_latin_letter(c)
   character, intent(in) :: c
   is_latin_letter = (c >= 'a' .and. c < = 'z')
end function

logical function is_punctuation(c)
   character, intent(in) :: c
   is_punctuation = (c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?')

contains

subroutine process_first(a, ans)

   integer, intent(in) :: a(:)

   integer, intent(out) :: ans

   integer, allocatable :: current(:), temp(:), new_temp(:)

   integer :: i, min_val

   logical :: has_one, exit_flag

   current = a

   do while (size(current) >1)

      ! Remove zeros

      temp = pack(current, current /=0) if (size(temp) ==0) then

         ans =0

         return

      end if

      min_val = temp(1)

      has_one = .false. new_temp = [min_val]

      do i =2, size(temp)

         mod_val = mod(temp(i), min_val)

         if (mod_val ==1) then

            ans =1

            return

         else if (mod_val ==0) then

            ! do not add to new_temp

         else

            new_temp = [new_temp, mod_val]

         end if

      end do

      ! Check if any mod_val was 1

      if (has_one) then

         ans =1

         return

      end if

      ! Sort new_temp

      call sort(new_temp)

      current = new_temp

   end do

   ans = current(1)
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
end subroutine process_first

! Function to sort an array (using a simple bubble sort for simplicity)

subroutine sort(arr)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer :: i, j, temp

   do i =1, size(arr) do j =i+1, size(arr)

         if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

         end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine sort

! Process second program

function process_second(s) result(processed_str)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   character(len=len_trim(s)+10) :: processed_str

   integer :: len, i

   logical :: is_latin_letter, is_punctuation

   processed_str = ''

   len = len_trim(s) if (len ==0) then

      processed_str = ''

      return

   end if

   processed_str = s(1:1)

   do i =2, len

      character(len=1) :: c, prev_c

      c = s(i:i)

      prev_c = s(i-1:i-1)

      if (is_latin_letter(c)) then

         if (.not. is_latin_letter(prev_c)) then

            processed_str = trim(processed_str) // ' '

         end if

         processed_str = trim(processed_str) // c

      else if (is_punctuation(c)) then

         processed_str = trim(processed_str) // c

      end if

   end do

end function process_second

logical function is_latin_letter(c)

   character(len=1), intent(in) :: c

   is_latin_letter = (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z')

end function

logical function is_punctuation(c)

   character(len=1), intent(in) :: c

   is_punctuation = (c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?')

end function

! Process third program

function process_third(s) result(bills)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   integer :: bills

   integer :: len, i, pos

   integer, dimension(0:len_trim(s)) :: digits

   len = len_trim(s)

   digits = 0

   do i =1, len

      pos = len -i +1

      digits(i-1) = ichar(s(pos:pos)) - ichar('0')

   end do

   digits(len) =0

   bills =0

   do i =0, len

      if (digits(i) ==10) then

         digits(i) =0

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

      end if

      if (digits(i) <5) then

         bills = bills + digits(i)

      else if (digits(i) ==5) then

         bills = bills +5

         if (digits(i+1) >=5) then

            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         end if

      else

         bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

      end if

   end do

end function process_third

end program main

The entire program will have:

1. Read the first input (n and list of integers).

2. Process the first program's logic to get ans.

Now, let's write the Fortran code step by step.

First, the first part (ABC118_C):

Read n and the list of integers.

Then process to get ans.

Implementing the loop:

We can use a dynamic array for a.

In Fortran, we can use an allocatable array.

program main

implicit none

integer :: n, i, ans, has_one, exit_flag

integer, allocatable :: a(:), temp(:), new_temp(:)

character(len=20) :: str_ans

character(len=200) :: processed_str

integer :: bills

! Read first input

read*, n

allocate(a(n))

read*, a

! Process first program

if (n ==1) then

   ans = a(1)

else

   call process_first(a, ans)

end if

! Convert ans to string

write(str_ans, '(i0)') ans

! Process second program

processed_str = process_second(str_ans)

! Process third program

bills = process_third(processed_str)

! Output

print*, bills

contains

subroutine process_first(a, ans)

   integer, intent(in) :: a(:)

   integer, intent(out) :: ans

   integer, allocatable :: current(:), temp(:), new_temp(:)

   integer :: i, min_val

   logical :: has_one, exit_flag

   current = a

   do while (size(current) >1)

      ! Remove zeros

      temp = pack(current, current /=0)

      if (size(temp) ==0) then

         ans =0

         return

      end if

      min_val = temp(1)

      has_one = .false.

      new_temp = [min_val]

      do i =2, size(temp)

         mod_val = mod(temp(i), min_val)

         if (mod_val ==1) then

            ans =1

            return

         else if (mod_val ==0) then

            ! do not add to new_temp

         else

            new_temp = [new_temp, mod_val]

         end if

      end do

      ! Check if any mod_val was 1

      if (has_one) then

         ans =1

         return

      end if

      ! Sort new_temp

      call sort(new_temp)

      current = new_temp

   end do

   ans = current(1)

end subroutine process_first

! Function to sort an array (using a simple bubble sort for simplicity)

subroutine sort(arr)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer :: i, j, temp

   do i =1, size(arr)

      do j =i+1, size(arr)

         if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

         end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine sort

! Process second program

function process_second(s) result(processed_str)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   character(len=len_trim(s)+10) :: processed_str

   integer :: len, i

   logical :: is_latin_letter, is_punctuation

   processed_str = ''

   len = len_trim(s)

   if (len ==0) then

      processed_str = ''

      return

   end if

   processed_str = s(1:1)

   do i =2, len

      character(len=1) :: c, prev_c

      c = s(i:i)

      prev_c = s(i-1:i-1)

      if (is_latin_letter(c)) then

         if (.not. is_latin_letter(prev_c)) then

            processed_str = trim(processed_str) // ' '

         end if

         processed_str = trim(processed_str) // c

      else if (is_punctuation(c)) then

         processed_str = trim(processed_str) // c

      end if

   end do

end function process_second

logical function is_latin_letter(c)

   character(len=1), intent(in) :: c

   is_latin_letter = (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z')

end function

logical function is_punctuation(c)

   character(len=1), intent(in) :: c

   is_punctuation = (c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?')

end function

! Process third program

function process_third(s) result(bills)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   integer :: bills

   integer :: len, i, pos

   integer, dimension(0:len_trim(s)) :: digits

   len = len_trim(s)

   digits = 0

   do i =1, len

      pos = len -i +1

      digits(i-1) = ichar(s(pos:pos)) - ichar('0')

   end do

   digits(len) =0

   bills =0

   do i =0, len

      if (digits(i) ==10) then

         digits(i) =0

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

      end if

      if (digits(i) <5) then

         bills = bills + digits(i)

      else if (digits(i) ==5) then

         bills = bills +5

         if (digits(i+1) >=5) then

            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

         end if

      else

         bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))

         digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1

      end if

   end do

end function process_third

end program main
